Class ThresholdUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • meka.core.ThresholdUtils

  • public abstract class ThresholdUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    ThresholdUtils - Helpful functions for calibrating thresholds.
    Version:
    March 2013
    Author:
    Jesse Read (jesse@tsc.uc3m.es)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ThresholdUtils() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double calibrateThreshold(java.util.ArrayList<double[]> Y, double LC_train)
      CalibrateThreshold - Calibrate a threshold using PCut: the threshold which results in the best approximation of the label cardinality of the training set.
      static double[] calibrateThresholds(java.util.ArrayList<double[]> Y, double[] LC_train)
      CalibrateThreshold - Calibrate a vector of thresholds (one for each label) using PCut: the threshold t[j] which results in the best approximation of the frequency of the j-th label in the training data.
      static int[][] round(double[][] Rpred)
      Round - simply round numbers (e.g., 2.0 to 2) -- for multi-target data (where we don't *yet* use a threshold).
      static int[][] threshold(double[][] Rpred, double t)
      Threshold - returns the labels after the prediction-confidence vector is passed through threshold.
      static int[][] threshold(double[][] Rpred, double[] t)
      Threshold - returns the labels after the prediction-confidence vector is passed through a vector of thresholds.
      static int[] threshold(double[] rpred, java.lang.String ts)
      Threshold - returns the labels after the prediction-confidence vector is passed through threshold(s).
      static double[] thresholdStringToArray(java.lang.String top, int L)
      ThresholdStringToArray - parse a threshold option string to an array of L thresholds (one for each label variable).

      • calibrateThreshold

        public static double calibrateThreshold(java.util.ArrayList<double[]> Y,
                        double LC_train)
        CalibrateThreshold - Calibrate a threshold using PCut: the threshold which results in the best approximation of the label cardinality of the training set.
        Parameters:
        Y - labels
        LC_train - label cardinality of the training set

      • calibrateThresholds

        public static double[] calibrateThresholds(java.util.ArrayList<double[]> Y,
                           double[] LC_train)
        CalibrateThreshold - Calibrate a vector of thresholds (one for each label) using PCut: the threshold t[j] which results in the best approximation of the frequency of the j-th label in the training data.
        Parameters:
        Y - labels
        LC_train[] - average frequency of each label

      • threshold

        public static final int[][] threshold(double[][] Rpred,
                double[] t)
        Threshold - returns the labels after the prediction-confidence vector is passed through a vector of thresholds.
        Parameters:
        Rpred[][] - label confidence predictions in [0,1]
        t[] - threshold for each label

      • threshold

        Threshold - returns the labels after the prediction-confidence vector is passed through threshold(s).
        Parameters:
        rpred[] - label confidence predictions in [0,1]
        ts - threshold String

      • round

        public static final int[][] round(double[][] Rpred)
        Round - simply round numbers (e.g., 2.0 to 2) -- for multi-target data (where we don't *yet* use a threshold).
        Parameters:
        Rpred[][] - class predictions in [0,1,...,K]
        Returns:
        integer representation of the predictions
